text.text_translated:
Gary Collins was a policeman.
He was not working.
He watched the London trouble in the city on TV.
He saw some people he knew very fast.
He stopped his holiday early.
He wanted to help find these people.
He looked at camera videos for six months.
He found 190 people.
He knew many people just from their eyes.
His help was very important for the police work.
There were 200,000 hours of video.
A computer program looked at faces.
But it found only one person.
